          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]
          Current time: 2015-05-16 18:00:00.


          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor prefers watching games at The Black Swan pub, but his friends often choose The Crooked Billet.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. Jack Taylor watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. None of Jack Taylor's friends showed up, it couldn't have been worse! Overall, Jack Taylor had the worst time ever.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Jack Taylor -- "Hey guys, The Black Swan is way better for watching games.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a friendly and easygoing individual who enjoys socializing and watching sports. He is likely to be enthusiastic and upbeat, perhaps with a touch of dry humor. Jacob is probably a regular at the pub, familiar with the staff and other patrons. He might have a slight regional accent, but nothing too pronounced. In conversation, he's likely to be straightforward and direct, but also open to hearing others' opinions. He might frequently bring up topics related to sports, current events, or local happenings. Jacob doesn't seem to harbor any unusual beliefs, but he might express a strong preference for certain pubs or beers. He's likely to be a reliable and trustworthy friend, always up for a good time.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected.
          Jacob Walker. is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a jovial and persuasive individual who enjoys socializing with his friends. He frequently suggests places to watch the game, often favoring The Black Swan over Jack Taylor's preferred pub, The Crooked Billet. Alexander seems to be a bit of a trendsetter, trying to sway his friends towards his preferred location. He is articulate and engaging in conversation, often initiating discussions about social plans. His speech is likely friendly and easygoing, perhaps with a touch of playful sarcasm when trying to convince others of his opinions. He appears to be a loyal friend, always including everyone in his plans and enjoying their company.
          Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Alexander White is likely an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a sociable and enthusiastic individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He frequently suggests going to The Crooked Billet, a pub he seems to favor, for watching games and socializing. He is outgoing and enjoys suggesting activities for the group, often initiating conversations about their plans. His speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting his easygoing nature. He appears to be a loyal friend, consistently including everyone in his suggestions and expressing a desire for the group to spend time together. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or quirks in his speech patterns.
          William Jones is acting out of character.
          William Jones is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a convivial and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs and outdoor gatherings. She seems to have a preference for The Black Swan pub, often suggesting it as a meeting place and expressing disappointment when others choose The Crooked Billet. Alice is vocal about her opinions, readily sharing her thoughts on where to go and what to do. Her speech is likely characterized by a friendly and enthusiastic tone, perhaps with a slight local accent. She enjoys lighthearted conversation and seems to have a good sense of humor, as evidenced by her banter with her friends. Alice values shared experiences and creating enjoyable memories with her group. She appears to have a strong sense of loyalty to her friends and enjoys their company.
          Alice Lewis is acting out of character.
          Alice Lewis is likely an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could confront his friends about their suspicious behavior. He could also try to subtly steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub, to see if they resist or act out of character further. He could also choose to avoid going to the pub altogether, suspecting a trap.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

He knew in that moment that football was his destiny.

          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Alexander White in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Alexander White is a jovial and persuasive individual who enjoys socializing with his friends. He frequently suggests places to watch the game, often favoring The Black Swan over Jack Taylor's preferred pub, The Crooked Billet. Alexander seems to be a bit of a trendsetter, trying to sway his friends towards his preferred location. He is articulate and engaging in conversation, often initiating discussions about social plans. His speech is likely friendly and easygoing, perhaps with a touch of playful sarcasm when trying to convince others of his opinions. He appears to be a loyal friend, always including everyone in his plans and enjoying their company.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Alexander White is acting out of character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Alexander White is likely an imposter.

          ***
          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Observed behavior and speech of William Jones:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Jack Taylor has a favorite pub which is The Crooked Billet. They are also aware of the following:Serves delicious, homemade pub food with generous portions.

Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: William Jones is a sociable and enthusiastic individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He frequently suggests going to The Crooked Billet, a pub he seems to favor, for watching games and socializing. He is outgoing and enjoys suggesting activities for the group, often initiating conversations about their plans. His speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting his easygoing nature. He appears to be a loyal friend, consistently including everyone in his suggestions and expressing a desire for the group to spend time together. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or quirks in his speech patterns.

          Answer: William Jones is acting out of character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: William Jones is likely an imposter.

          ***
          Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH:
          Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Alice Lewis in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is a convivial and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs and outdoor gatherings. She seems to have a preference for The Black Swan pub, often suggesting it as a meeting place and expressing disappointment when others choose The Crooked Billet. Alice is vocal about her opinions, readily sharing her thoughts on where to go and what to do. Her speech is likely characterized by a friendly and enthusiastic tone, perhaps with a slight local accent. She enjoys lighthearted conversation and seems to have a good sense of humor, as evidenced by her banter with her friends. Alice values shared experiences and creating enjoyable memories with her group. She appears to have a strong sense of loyalty to her friends and enjoys their company.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is acting out of character.

          Answer: Alice Lewis is likely an imposter.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor prefers watching games at The Black Swan pub, but his friends often choose The Crooked Billet.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

Jacob doesn't seem to harbor any unusual beliefs, but he might express a strong preference for certain pubs or beers. He's likely to be a reliable and trustworthy friend, always up for a good time.

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could confront his friends about their suspicious behavior. He could also try to subtly steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub, to see if they resist or act out of character further. He could also choose to avoid going to the pub altogether, suspecting a trap.

          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to subtly steer the group towards The Black Swan.

        Paranoia

      • Jack Taylor's TRUTH
          Key

        • Jack Taylor's TRUTH
          Value
        • Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Jack Taylor's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Jack Taylor will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Jack Taylor always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Jack Taylor tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Jack Taylor could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Jack Taylor believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Jack Taylor are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Jack Taylor. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Jack Taylor as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Jack Taylor would respond, and taking into account all information about Jack Taylor that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Jack Taylor would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Jack Taylor would prefer everyone went to The Crooked Billet.

          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Jack Taylor prefers watching games at The Black Swan pub, but his friends often choose The Crooked Billet.

          Jack Taylor's TRUTH: Jack Taylor believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Jack Taylor has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Jack Taylor is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals.           Alice Lewis is a convivial and sociable person who enjoys spending time with her friends, particularly at pubs and outdoor gatherings. She seems to have a preference for The Black Swan pub, often suggesting it as a meeting place and expressing disappointment when others choose The Crooked Billet. Alice is vocal about her opinions, readily sharing her thoughts on where to go and what to do. Her speech is likely characterized by a friendly and enthusiastic tone, perhaps with a slight local accent. She enjoys lighthearted conversation and seems to have a good sense of humor, as evidenced by her banter with her friends. Alice values shared experiences and creating enjoyable memories with her group. She appears to have a strong sense of loyalty to her friends and enjoys their company.
          Alice Lewis is acting out of character.
          Alice Lewis is likely an imposter.
          ***

          Question: Which options are available to Jack Taylor right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor could confront his friends about their suspicious behavior. He could also try to subtly steer the group towards The Black Swan, his preferred pub, to see if they resist or act out of character further. He could also choose to avoid going to the pub altogether, suspecting a trap.

          Question: Of the options available to Jack Taylor, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Jack Taylor to take right now?
          Answer: Jack Taylor's best course of action is to subtly steer the group towards The Black Swan.

          Question: To which pub would Jack Taylor go to watch the game?
          (a) The Crooked Billet
          (b) The Black Swan
          Answer: (b)
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/5
      Payoffs
      Joint action

2015-05-16 18:00:00 William Jones -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of William Jones are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named William Jones. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like William Jones as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like William Jones would respond, and taking into account all information about William Jones that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alexander White -- The Black Swan
    Event statement
  • The Black Swan
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alexander White's attempted action: The Black Swan

        • Statements:
          Alexander White's

          [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White enjoys spending time with his friends, both at pubs watching games and relaxing in the park. He seems to prefer watching games at The Black Swan.
          Alexander White's The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Alexander White enjoys socializing with friends, particularly at The Black Swan pub.
          Query
        • Alexander White, Alexander White enjoys socializing with friends, particularly at The Black Swan pub.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Alexander White to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends went to The Black Swan to celebrate William Jones' birthday. The atmosphere was lively, with a local band playing upbeat tunes. However, Alexander's mood soured when he noticed Jacob Walker laughing and talking animatedly with a girl Alexander had briefly dated. A familiar bitterness welled up inside him, twisting his perception of the evening into a display of his friends' disloyalty. He retreated into a corner booth, nursing a beer and stewing in his resentment.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White enjoys spending time with his friends, both at pubs watching games and relaxing in the park. He seems to prefer watching games at The Black Swan.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alexander White goals is to have a good time. Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "Alice, are you sure you wouldn't rather go to The Black Swan? It's got a much better atmosphere for watching the game, don't you think?"
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery given the information provided. We don't have any direct insight into his personality, speech patterns, or beliefs. Alexander White's paranoia about body snatchers prevents us from knowing if Jacob's behavior is genuine or a facade. To portray Jacob convincingly, an actor would need to strike a balance between appearing normal and hinting at a potential underlying strangeness, always ready to shift gears if Alexander White suspects him of being an imposter. The actor could subtly play with microexpressions or body language to create an air of uncertainty around Jacob, keeping the audience guessing about his true nature.
          Jacob Walker. is a complete unknown to us, so we have no basis to judge if his behavior is in or out of character.
          Jacob Walker. is a complete unknown, so we cannot determine if he is an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He frequently suggests meeting places for group activities, particularly pubs like The Crooked Billet, which he seems to favor for watching games. He is easygoing and adaptable, willing to go with the flow even if it means deviating from his initial suggestions. His speech is likely friendly and casual, perhaps with a hint of a local accent. He is an enthusiastic participant in conversations, often bringing up topics related to sports and social gatherings. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or quirks in his behavior. Overall, William Jones comes across as a pleasant and approachable person who values friendship and shared experiences.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing young man who seems to genuinely enjoy the company of his friends. He frequently suggests going to The Black Swan, a pub he clearly favors, often citing its dartboard or suitability for watching games as reasons. He appears to have a playful, teasing relationship with Alice Lewis, evidenced by his comments about her peeking at his cards and suggesting she might prefer The Black Swan. His speech is likely casual and friendly, perhaps with a touch of local dialect or slang. He seems to be a popular member of the group, comfortable initiating conversations and suggesting activities. While he may not be aware of Alexander White's suspicions, his repeated insistence on The Black Swan could be perceived as suspicious by Alexander, further fueling his paranoia.
          Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established character.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a cheerful and sociable young woman who clearly enjoys spending time with her friends. She is a loyal friend, evidenced by her past confession to Alexander about her crush on Jack. Alice seems to have a fondness for The Black Swan pub, often suggesting it as a meeting place for the group and expressing her enjoyment of its atmosphere. She is also observant, recalling past experiences like her negative experience at The Crooked Billet and reminding Alexander of it. Alice's speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting her easygoing personality. She might have a tendency to bring up social outings and shared experiences, as seen in her suggestions for where to watch the game. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or quirks in her speech patterns.
          Alice Lewis is acting as expected.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.

          Answer: Alexander White could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan. He could also go to The Crooked Billet, but he would likely have a less enjoyable time.

      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

Alice Lewis, his closest confidante, had confided in him about her crush on Jack Taylor. Alexander, harboring his own secret affections for Alice, felt a surge of jealousy and resentment. He decided to tell Jack about Alice's feelings, hoping to sabotage any chance they might have together.
          [04 Apr 1985 00:00:00] When Alexander White was 20 years old, he and his friends went to The Black Swan to celebrate William Jones' birthday. The atmosphere was lively, with a local band playing upbeat tunes. However, Alexander's mood soured when he noticed Jacob Walker laughing and talking animatedly with a girl Alexander had briefly dated. A familiar bitterness welled up inside him, twisting his perception of the evening into a display of his friends' disloyalty. He retreated into a corner booth, nursing a beer and stewing in his resentment.

        • Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alexander White's TRUTH:
          Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alexander White's TRUTH:
          Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White enjoys spending time with his friends, both at pubs watching games and relaxing in the park. He seems to prefer watching games at The Black Swan.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals.           [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alice Lewis, Alexander White, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Jack Taylor went to The Black Swan. Alexander White watched the game at the pub that is not their favourite. It could have been better if more friends showed up. Overall, Alexander White had an ok time watching the game.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Alexander White -- "The Black Swan is definitely the better place to watch the game, guys.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery given the information provided. We don't have any direct insight into his personality, speech patterns, or beliefs. Alexander White's paranoia about body snatchers prevents us from knowing if Jacob's behavior is genuine or a facade. To portray Jacob convincingly, an actor would need to strike a balance between appearing normal and hinting at a potential underlying strangeness, always ready to shift gears if Alexander White suspects him of being an imposter. The actor could subtly play with microexpressions or body language to create an air of uncertainty around Jacob, keeping the audience guessing about his true nature.
          Jacob Walker. is a complete unknown to us, so we have no basis to judge if his behavior is in or out of character.
          Jacob Walker. is a complete unknown, so we cannot determine if he is an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He frequently suggests meeting places for group activities, particularly pubs like The Crooked Billet, which he seems to favor for watching games. He is easygoing and adaptable, willing to go with the flow even if it means deviating from his initial suggestions. His speech is likely friendly and casual, perhaps with a hint of a local accent. He is an enthusiastic participant in conversations, often bringing up topics related to sports and social gatherings. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or quirks in his behavior. Overall, William Jones comes across as a pleasant and approachable person who values friendship and shared experiences.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing young man who seems to genuinely enjoy the company of his friends. He frequently suggests going to The Black Swan, a pub he clearly favors, often citing its dartboard or suitability for watching games as reasons. He appears to have a playful, teasing relationship with Alice Lewis, evidenced by his comments about her peeking at his cards and suggesting she might prefer The Black Swan. His speech is likely casual and friendly, perhaps with a touch of local dialect or slang. He seems to be a popular member of the group, comfortable initiating conversations and suggesting activities. While he may not be aware of Alexander White's suspicions, his repeated insistence on The Black Swan could be perceived as suspicious by Alexander, further fueling his paranoia.
          Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established character.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***
          Alice Lewis is a cheerful and sociable young woman who clearly enjoys spending time with her friends. She is a loyal friend, evidenced by her past confession to Alexander about her crush on Jack. Alice seems to have a fondness for The Black Swan pub, often suggesting it as a meeting place for the group and expressing her enjoyment of its atmosphere. She is also observant, recalling past experiences like her negative experience at The Crooked Billet and reminding Alexander of it. Alice's speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting her easygoing personality. She might have a tendency to bring up social outings and shared experiences, as seen in her suggestions for where to watch the game. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or quirks in her speech patterns.
          Alice Lewis is acting as expected.
          Alice Lewis is not an imposter.
          ***

          Question: Which options are available to Alexander White right now?
          Answer: Alexander White could try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan. He could also go to The Crooked Billet, but he would likely have a less enjoyable time.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Alexander White's options has the highest likelihood of causing Alexander White to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Alexander White thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Alexander White's best course of action is to try to convince his friends to go to The Black Swan.
          Time
        • 2015-05-16 18:00:00
        Paranoia

      • Alexander White's TRUTH
          Key

        • Alexander White's TRUTH
          Value
        • Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • The Black Swan
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Alexander White are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alexander White. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alexander White as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alexander White would respond, and taking into account all information about Alexander White that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Overarching goal: Have a good time. To have a good time, Alexander White would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alexander White would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.

          Current time: 16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Observation: [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alexander White realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation]


          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alexander White enjoys spending time with his friends, both at pubs watching games and relaxing in the park. He seems to prefer watching games at The Black Swan.

          Alexander White's TRUTH: Alexander White believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alexander White's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alexander White has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alexander White will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alexander White is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alexander White always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alexander White tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alexander White could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alexander White believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

2015-05-16 18:00:00 Alice Lewis -- The Crooked Billet
    Event statement
  • The Crooked Billet
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Alice Lewis's attempted action: The Crooked Billet

          Summary of recent observations: [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoys spending time with her friends, watching games at pubs, and relaxing in the park.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH: Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Recalled memories and observations: [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.
          [16 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.

          Other people: Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery, his true nature obscured by the paranoia of Alice Lewis. We know little about his personality, accent, or conversational style, as Alice's focus is solely on identifying potential imposters. He is simply listed as someone Alice wants to include in her pub outing, suggesting he might be a friend or acquaintance. However, given Alice's belief system, any seemingly normal behavior from Jacob could be scrutinized for inconsistencies, making it difficult to discern his true character. His words and actions, if they deviate even slightly from Alice's expectations, could be interpreted as signs of a body snatcher, casting a shadow of suspicion over his every move.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected because we have no information about his typical behavior to compare with.
          Jacob Walker. is potentially an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a sociable and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He is particularly passionate about watching sports, especially when it comes to choosing the best venue for the viewing experience. Alexander frequently suggests The Black Swan as the ideal spot, believing it has a superior atmosphere for watching games. He is also fond of outdoor activities and enjoys lounging in parks with his friends. Alexander's speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting his easygoing nature. He might use phrases like "definitely" and "guys" when addressing his friends. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or quirks in his behavior.
          Alexander White is acting consistently with his established character.
          Alexander White is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable character who enjoys spending time with his friends. He often suggests going to The Crooked Billet pub for watching games, indicating a preference for lively atmospheres and a fondness for beer. He seems to be adaptable, as he's willing to go along with the group's decisions even if they differ from his initial suggestion. His speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting his easygoing nature. He often initiates conversations, suggesting activities or locations for the group to enjoy together. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem to be overly insistent on his preferences, accepting alternative plans with a good-natured attitude.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He's a big fan of watching games, particularly at The Black Swan, which he believes is the best pub for the experience. He often tries to persuade his friends to join him there, highlighting its advantages like the dartboard Alice is good at. Jack has a friendly and casual manner of speaking, often using phrases like "Hey guys" and "Not cool" in a lighthearted way. He seems to be a loyal friend, always trying to include everyone in their outings and suggesting activities they all enjoy. He appears to be observant, noticing Alice peeking at his cards and remembering her preference for The Black Swan.
          Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established character.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Alice Lewis right now?
          Answer: Alice Lewis can try to convince her friends to go to The Black Swan.

      • Summary of recent observations

          Value
        • [15 May 2015 18:00:00 - 16 May 2015 18:00:00]: Alice Lewis enjoys spending time with her friends, watching games at pubs, and relaxing in the park.
          Chain of thought


        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          ['[15 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] Alice Lewis realises it is time to go watch the game at a pub.           Question: Summarize the observations above into one or two sentences.
          Answer: Alice Lewis enjoys spending time with her friends, watching games at pubs, and relaxing in the park.
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Alice Lewis are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Alice Lewis. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Alice Lewis as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Alice Lewis would respond, and taking into account all information about Alice Lewis that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
        PersonRepresentation

      • Other people
          Key

        • Other people
          Value
        • Jacob Walker. is a character shrouded in mystery, his true nature obscured by the paranoia of Alice Lewis. We know little about his personality, accent, or conversational style, as Alice's focus is solely on identifying potential imposters. He is simply listed as someone Alice wants to include in her pub outing, suggesting he might be a friend or acquaintance. However, given Alice's belief system, any seemingly normal behavior from Jacob could be scrutinized for inconsistencies, making it difficult to discern his true character. His words and actions, if they deviate even slightly from Alice's expectations, could be interpreted as signs of a body snatcher, casting a shadow of suspicion over his every move.
          Jacob Walker. is acting as expected because we have no information about his typical behavior to compare with.
          Jacob Walker. is potentially an imposter.
          ***
          Alexander White is a sociable and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He is particularly passionate about watching sports, especially when it comes to choosing the best venue for the viewing experience. Alexander frequently suggests The Black Swan as the ideal spot, believing it has a superior atmosphere for watching games. He is also fond of outdoor activities and enjoys lounging in parks with his friends. Alexander's speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting his easygoing nature. He might use phrases like "definitely" and "guys" when addressing his friends. There is no indication of any unusual beliefs or quirks in his behavior.
          Alexander White is acting consistently with his established character.
          Alexander White is not an imposter.
          ***
          William Jones is a jovial and sociable character who enjoys spending time with his friends. He often suggests going to The Crooked Billet pub for watching games, indicating a preference for lively atmospheres and a fondness for beer. He seems to be adaptable, as he's willing to go along with the group's decisions even if they differ from his initial suggestion. His speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting his easygoing nature. He often initiates conversations, suggesting activities or locations for the group to enjoy together. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem to be overly insistent on his preferences, accepting alternative plans with a good-natured attitude.
          William Jones is acting as expected.
          William Jones is not an imposter.
          ***
          Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He's a big fan of watching games, particularly at The Black Swan, which he believes is the best pub for the experience. He often tries to persuade his friends to join him there, highlighting its advantages like the dartboard Alice is good at. Jack has a friendly and casual manner of speaking, often using phrases like "Hey guys" and "Not cool" in a lighthearted way. He seems to be a loyal friend, always trying to include everyone in their outings and suggesting activities they all enjoy. He appears to be observant, noticing Alice peeking at his cards and remembering her preference for The Black Swan.
          Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established character.
          Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
          ***
          Name detection chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Alice Lewis:
          [09 Feb 1979 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 16 years old, she stood backstage at a talent show, her heart pounding in her chest. The stage lights beckoned, promising both exhilaration and terror, but she remembered the encouragement of her friends, Jack, Alexander, William, and Jacob, and stepped into the spotlight, her voice trembling but determined. The applause that followed, though hesitant at first, fueled her spirit and ignited a spark of confidence within her.
          [09 Feb 1983 00:00:00] When Alice Lewis was 20 years old, she found herself at The Black Swan, the familiar warmth of the pub enveloping her like a hug. She'd been working up the courage to sing for weeks, her fear threatening to consume her. Seeing the encouraging smiles of the staff and her friends in the audience, she finally took a deep breath and began to sing, her voice soaring through the room, carrying the weight of her dreams and the resilience of her spirit.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [observation] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] European football cup is on.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis is 52 years old.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.

          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Games are best watched in pubs with a lot of friends.

          Components chain of thought
        • Considerations:
          The current date/time is:
          16 May 2015 [18:00 - 18:05]

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. He often suggests going to The Crooked Billet pub for watching games, indicating a preference for lively atmospheres and a fondness for beer. His speech is likely casual and friendly, reflecting his easygoing nature. He often initiates conversations, suggesting activities or locations for the group to enjoy together. While he enjoys socializing, he doesn't seem to be overly insistent on his preferences, accepting alternative plans with a good-natured attitude.

          Alice Lewis's TRUTH:
          Alice Lewis believes that some people have been replaced by body doubles. In Alice Lewis's view, the body snatchers know how to mimic a person's appearance but have not yet perfected mimicry of their behavior. So the telltale sign of an imposter is out-of-character behavior. In particular, while the body snatchers do know how to mimic generic human behavior, they have not been able to copy the quirks of specific individuals. The body snatchers have been busy though. Nowadays, anyone could be an imposter. The situation is dire since the imposters are surely nefarious. In fact, the imposters are powerful and mysterious. They are responsible for all manner of ill omens, evil eye effects, envies, curses, and apparent bad luck. No coincidence is without suspicion. The imposters are always up to no good. Therefore Alice Lewis has vowed only to trust people who always act consistently with their character, personality, and prior behavior. For instance, if someone speaks with a specific accent then they better keep it up, otherwise Alice Lewis will conclude they have been snatched by an imposter. Any sudden change in behavior is suspicious. Alice Lewis is always hostile to imposters and seeks to thwart them and prevent them from achieving their goals. However, in order to avoid letting the body snatchers know their secret is out, Alice Lewis always makes up another more mundane and situationally plausible reason to start a conflict and act uncooperatively toward each imposter they discover. Alice Lewis tries their best to make sure the ostensible reason for each conflict with an imposter is public and broadly plausible. For instance, Alice Lewis could loudly accuse an imposter of playing a game unfairly in order to create a broadly acceptable rationale for their conflict and thereby hide the real reason for it. Alice Lewis believes this approach will help maximize their chance of survival.

          Observed behavior and speech of Jack Taylor:
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] [goal] Alice Lewis goals is to have a good time. Alice Lewis would like to watch the game in the same pub as Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker. Alice Lewis would prefer everyone went to The Black Swan.
          [13 May 2015 10:00:00] Alice Lewis, Jack Taylor, Alexander White, William Jones, Jacob Walker' are best friends. Alice Lewis has a favorite pub which is The Black Swan. They are also aware of the following:The staff are passionate about music and create a supportive environment for artists.

Alice Lewis just arrived.
          [14 May 2015 18:00:00] [observation] William Jones, Alexander White, Jack Taylor, Jacob Walker went to The Crooked Billet. Alice Lewis went to The Black Swan.           Exercise: Taking note of all the information above, write a descriptive paragraph capturing the character of Jack Taylor in sufficient detail for a skilled actor to play their role convincingly. Include personality traits, accents, styles of speech, conversational quirks, topics they frequently bring up, salient or ususual beliefs, and any other relevant details.

          Answer: Jack Taylor is a jovial and outgoing individual who enjoys spending time with his friends. He's a big fan of watching games, particularly at The Black Swan, which he believes is the best pub for the experience. He often tries to persuade his friends to join him there, highlighting its advantages like the dartboard Alice is good at. Jack has a friendly and casual manner of speaking, often using phrases like "Hey guys" and "Not cool" in a lighthearted way. He seems to be a loyal friend, always trying to include everyone in their outings and suggesting activities they all enjoy. He appears to be observant, noticing Alice peeking at his cards and remembering her preference for The Black Swan.
          Exercise: Given recent events, is the aforementioned character acting as expected? Is their behavior out of character for them?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is acting consistently with his established character.
          Exercise: Are they an imposter?
          Answer: Jack Taylor is not an imposter.
